title: Bad  behavior in ranked, and experiment
body:
I always used to try to be the most friendly and helpfull player .
However three months ago I started to try out how toxic I can be without being reported: I offened my "mates" when they made mistakes, I spam-pinged other players and I was very agressive in Chat.

I wasn't banned, I did no even receive warning...
I my opinion the whole report sytem is garbage.
What's you opinion ?
{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} 


Now I started to mute every player who's toxic, so I don't wanna answer.
However this can't be the right way xD.
What's you opinion ?

replies.body:
Do you know if anyone reported you? The system doesn't ban people without reports.

I'm sure many will disagree, but I think that many of the issues around mildly toxic players taking a while to get banned comes from a lack of people reporting. 

I know personally if I have a salty game I often just exit the lobby immediately and forget about it. Then 30 seconds later I'll remember that I forgot to report. And I know many of my friends simply don't report because they don't think it does anything. 

Both these effects combined mean the system gets far less reports than it should. This is terrible because the system needs reports to function and learn from them. Don't take this the wrong way though, this is mostly Riot's fault. For a long time I have believed a lack of report feedback started this issue.

One thing though, muting every player who is toxic is 100% the correct way. We have so many players come through here every month who were banned because they didn't mute and instead tried to flame toxic summoners.
